conclusion: Analyze the graph of acceleration versus displacement and use kinematic equations.
The graph shows acceleration is constant at a0 from x = 0 to x = x1, then decreases linearly to zero at x = x3.
The object starts from rest, so initial velocity v0 = 0.
Acceleration is constant at a0 in the interval 0 ≤ x ≤ x1.
Use kinematic equation v^2 = v0^2 + 2a(x - x0) with v0 = 0, a = a0, x = x1.
The magnitude of the object's velocity when displacement is x1 is √(2a0 x1).
